frqParts.text: Consider the curve given by x2 + 4y2 = 7 + 3xy. (a) Show that <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>y</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>8</mn> <mi>y</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>.
(b) Show that there is a point P with x-coordinate 3 at which the line tangent to the curve at P is horizontal. Find the y-coordinate of P.

(c) Find the value of <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>d</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> at the point P found in part (b). Does the curve have a local maximum, a local minimum, or neither at the point P? Justify your answer.
